monster.name: Otherworldly Familiar

hp.special: 2 + 2 per spell level (the familiar has a number of Hit Dice [d4s] equal to the spell's level)

languages: Telepathy 120ft. (only between you and the familiar),

trait.name: Amphibious (Water Only)
entries: The familiar can breathe air and water.

action.name: Otherworldly Scratch
entries: {@atk ms} your Spell Attack Modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 + the spell's level of Radiant damage (Celestial), Psychic damage (Fey), or Necrotic damage (Fiend).

reaction.name: Deliver Spell
entries: When you cast a spell with a range of touch, the familiar can deliver the spell with its touch. To do so, the familiar must be within 120 feet of you. It can do this a number of times equal to half the spell's level rounded up and regains all uses on a long rest.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}Force damage equal to {@damage 1d4 - 3} + your spellcasting ability modifier (Medium or smaller), {@damage 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier (Large), or {@damage 2d12 + 3} + your spellcasting ability modifier (Huge).

monster.name: Otherworldly Steed

hp.special: 5 + 10 per spell level (the steed has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to the spell's level)

languages: Telepathy 1 mile (only between you and the steed)

action.name: Otherworldly Maul
entries: {@atk ms} your Spell Attack Modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@dice 1d8} + the spell's level of Radiant damage (Celestial), Psychic damage (Fey), or Necrotic damage (Fiend).

bonus.name: Idyllic Step (Idyllic Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The steed teleports, along with its rider, to an unoccupied space of your choice up to 60 feet away.

bonus.name: Biblical Glare (Biblical Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Numerous eyes open as it targets one creature it can perceive up to 60 feet away. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for one minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

bonus.name: Exalted Touch (Exalted Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The steed touches another creature and restores a number of Hit Points to it equal to {@dice 2d8} + the spell's level.

trait.name: Life Bond
entries: When you regain Hit Points from a level 1+ spell, the steed regains the same number of Hit Points if you're within 5 feet of it.

spell.name: True Strike

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail an attack roll

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain all uses after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of uses increases by 1 at 5th level (2 uses), 11th level (3 uses), and 17th level (4 uses).

spell.name: Guidance

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail an ability check

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain all uses after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of uses increases by 1 at 5th level (2 uses), 11th level (3 uses), and 17th level (4 uses).

spell.name: Resistance

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail a saving throw

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain all uses after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of uses increases by 1 at 5th level (2 uses), 11th level (3 uses), and 17th level (4 uses).

spell.name: Magic Stone
entries: You touch one to three pebbles and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it or hurling it with a sling, slingshot or warsling. If thrown, it has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with the pebble, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attacker's, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on the stone. If you cast this spell again, the spell ends early on any pebbles still affected by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The attack's damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@dice d8}), 11({@dice d10}), and 17 ({@dice d12}).

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature you can touch get hit by an attack or targeted by the Magic Missiles spell

entries: A spectral shield appears and protects the creature you touched for one minute. They can gain 2 AC against one attack of their choice that would hit them. They can choose to instead gain immunity to 4 magic missiles (from the Magic Missiles spell) of their choice that target them. They do not apply the bonus to their AC if a positive bonus is already being applied to it by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, the number of attacks or magic missiles they can choose increases by one for each slot level above 1.

spell.name: Absorb Elements

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: Subtract a {@dice d6} from the damage of the triggering damage type that the creature took. Once before the end of their next turn when they hit with a melee attack they may deal additional damage of the same amount and type prevented.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount subtracted increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Feather Fall

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 60ft falls

entries: The falling creature makes a dexterity saving throw, which they can choose to fail. If they fail, their rate of descent slows to 30 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

components.m: a small feather or piece of down

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can target an additional creature for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Gift of Gab

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 90ft hears you speak

entries: You attempt to skillfully reshape the memories of a listener. The target makes an Intelligence Saving Throw. If they fail, they forget everything you said within the last 6 seconds, including the verbal components of spells, and remember that you actually said the words you speak as the verbal component of this spell. Additionally, it does not notice you performing the somatic components of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can target one additional creature per additional spell level.

spell.name: Soul Cage

time.condition: which you take when a humanoid you can see within 60ft of you dies

entries: This spell snatches the soul of a humanoid as it dies and traps it inside the tiny cage you use for the material component. A stolen soul remains inside the cage until the spell ends or until you destroy the cage, which ends the spell. While you have a soul inside the cage, you can exploit it in any of the ways described below. You can use a trapped soul up to six times. Once you exploit a soul for the sixth time, it is released, and the spell ends. While a soul is trapped, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.
Steal Life. You can use a bonus action to drain vigor from the soul and regain {@dice 2d8} hit points.

Query Soul. You ask the soul a question (no action required) and receive a brief telepathic answer, which you can understand regardless of the language used. The soul knows only what it knew in life, but it must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. The answer is no more than a sentence or two and might be cryptic.

Borrow Experience. You can use a bonus action to bolster yourself with the soul's life experience, making your next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage. If you don't use this benefit before the start of your next turn, it is lost.

Eyes of the Dead. You can use an action to name a place the humanoid saw in life, which creates an {@condition invisible} sensor somewhere in that place if it is on the plane of existence you're currently on. The sensor remains for as long as you concentrate, up to 10 minutes (as if you were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). You receive visual and auditory information from the sensor as if you were in its space using your senses.
A creature that can see the sensor (such as one using see invisibility or truesight) sees a translucent image of the tormented humanoid whose soul you caged.

m.text: a tiny silver cage worth 100 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level you can exploit the soul an additional 2 times for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Temporal Shunt

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see within 30ft is about to make an attack roll or cast a spell

entries: You target yourself and the triggering creature. Each target must succeed on a wisdom saving throw or be thrown to the same random point in time. If the triggering creature failed, the attack or spell they were about to make is canceled before it's used. At the start of the triggering creature's next turn, each target returns to the present in the nearest unoccupied space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target an additional creature of your choice that you can see within 30ft for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Hunter's Mark
entries: You magically mark one creature you can see within range as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage to the target the first time you hit it with an attack roll on any turn. You choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. You also have Advantage on any Wisdom (Perception or Survival) check you make to find it.
If the target drops to 0 or less Hit Points before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to move the mark to a new creature you can see within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d6}.

spell.name: Jump
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the start of your next turn, their jump distance increases by 10 ft. Additionally, once within the duration they can move up to 10 ft during a jump without spending movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 2 or higher, their jump distance and the distance they can move without spending movement increases by 10ft for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Zephyr Strike
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action before making an attack roll with a weapon. Give the attack roll advantage. Immediately after the attack hits you can move up to 10 ft in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the distance you move by 10 ft for each additional level (up to a maximum of 60 ft).

spell.name: Healing Spirit
entries: You call forth a nature spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot cube you can see within range. It looks like a transparent beast or fey.

You can cause the spirit to restore {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points to yourself or a creature you can see (no action required). The target must be within the spirits space. If you do, you cannot heal the target in that way again until the start of its next turn. The spirit can heal a number of times equal to 1 + your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of twice). After healing that number of times, the spirit disappears.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the Spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 3 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Vortex Warp
entries: You magically twist space around another creature you can see within range that is large or smaller. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (they can choose to fail), or the target is teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the target without the target having to squeeze.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Evard's Black Tentacles

components.m: a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus or a giant squid

entries: Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, flat surfaces in the area are difficult terrain.

Whenever a creature is in the affected area it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until the start of its next turn. After making the saving throw they don't need to do so again until the start of their next turn. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}.

At the start of each of its turns the target can repeat the saving throw, breaking free on a success. As an action the target or a creature the target is within reach of can make a Strength (Athletics) check against the save DC. On a success, the target is no longer {@condition restrained}.

spell.name: Web
entries: You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are Difficult Terrain, and the area within them is Lightly Obscured.

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn.

Whenever a creature is in the affected area it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the webs until the start of it's next turn. After a creature makes this saving throw it doesn't need to do so again until the start of its next turn. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}.

At the start of each of its turns the {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success it is no longer {@condition restrained}. As an action the target or a creature the target is within reach of can make a Strength (Athletics) check against the save DC. On a success, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.

If the webs are exposed to fire they all burn. Any creature that is {@condition restrained} by the webs while they are burning takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage. Once they take this damage they cannot take it again until the start of their next turn. After 1 round of burning, all the webs are burned away and the spell ends.

spell.name: Ceremony

m.text: 25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: Choose one of the following ceremonies. Decorations for that type of ceremony worth a total of 50 gp appear in locations of your choice within 15 ft of where you began casting this spell. After 24 hours the decorations disappear. Anyone who closely inspects the decorations can see that they are fake. Once within the duration while you and your targets are in the affected area you can use your action to perform the effect for this type of ceremony (listed below).

entries.name: Atonement
entries: You touch one willing creature whose alignment has changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a successful check, you restore the target to its original alignment.

entries.name: Bless Water
entries: You touch one vial of water and cause it to become holy water.

entries.name: Coming of Age
entries: You touch one humanoid who is a young adult. For the next 24 hours, they cannot be aged (magically or otherwise). A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Dedication
entries: You touch one humanoid who wishes to be dedicated to your diety's service. Once within the next 24 hours when you cast a spell with a range of touch the creature can use their reaction to deliver the spell with their touch instead of yours if they are within 90 ft of you. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Funeral Rite
entries: You touch one corpse, and for the next 7 days, the target can't become undead by any means short of a Wish spell.

entries.name: Wedding
entries: You touch willing adult humanoids. Each target can sense what other alive adult humanoids the other targets have married previously in this way. If the targets are still willing, they are bonded in marriage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of second level or higher, the radius of the spell increases by 15 ft and the perceived price of the decorations is tripled for every spell slot above 1st.

spell.name: Wish
entries: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself.

Cast another spell of 8th level or lower without expending a spell slot or its casting time. You do not need to know the spell or have it prepared. This spell's casting time is the casting time of the spell you pick. You don't need to meet any requirements to cast the spell, including costly components.

Instead of casting another spell you can make a boundless wish. State your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM chooses a casting time and effect based on the wish. They can utilize any room for interpretation in the wish to make it do something other than what you intended. If the effect would be more powerful than the spells you could have casted with this spell, the DM prevents this by reducing the power of the effect, adding unintended consequences, or a combination of both.

The stress of casting Wish to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for {@dice 2d4} days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a 33 percent chance that you are unable to cast Wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

spell.name: Forcecage

m.text: ruby dust worth 1,500+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: An immobile, {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, Cube-shaped prison composed of magical force springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box, as you choose.

A prison in the shape of a cage can be up to 20 feet on a side and is made from 1/2-inch diameter bars spaced 1/2 inch apart. A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any spells cast into or out from the area.

When you cast the spell, any creature that is completely inside the cage's area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside it, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside it.

A creature inside the cage can't leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can use that magic to exit the cage. On a failed save, the creature doesn't exit the cage and wastes the spell or effect. The cage also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel. The cage has an AC of 5 and 240 hit points.
This spell can't be dispelled by Dispel Magic.

spell.name: Magic Jar

m.text: a gem, crystal, or reliquary worth 500+ GP

entries: Your body falls into a catatonic state as your soul leaves it and enters the container you used for the spell's material component. Any soul that inhabits the container is aware of their surroundings as if they were in the container's space. They cannot move or take actions, reactions, bonus actions or similar acts. You in particular can use your action to attempt to possess the body of a humanoid you can see within 100 ft.

If you attempt to possess a creature, it makes a charisma saving throw. On a failure, your soul moves into the target's body, and the target's soul becomes trapped in the container. They target automatically fails the saving throw if it has no soul. On a success, the target resists your efforts to possess it, and you can't attempt to possess it again for 24 hours. Creatures warded by a protection from evil and good or magic circle spell can't be possessed.

The spell ends on any creature that possesses its own body. A creatures can control the body it is possessing. Its Hit Points, Hit Point Dice, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Speed, and senses are replaced by the body's. It otherwise keeps its game statistics.
While possessing a body, you can take a Magic action to return to the container if it is within 100 feet of you. If there is already a soul in the container, it moves to the body you left.
If the following happens to a body or container, the soul it contains moves to a different body or to the container (whichever is closest):

items: the container or body is destroyed
the body drops to zero hit points, dies or ceases to be humanoid
the spell ends on a body or the container

entries: The target it moves to must not have a soul and must be within a mile. If a soul remains in a dead body it dies with it.
When the spell ends, the container is destroyed.

spell.name: Compelled Duel
entries: One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains the angered condition against you for 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, you can target one additional creature for each additional level.

spell.name: Geas
entries: You give a verbal command to a creature that you can see within range, ordering it to carry out some service or refrain from an action or a course of activity as you decide. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The target automatically succeeds if it can't understand your command. If you concentrate on the spell for the full duration, the effect lasts for 30 days.
While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the creature takes {@damage 5d10} Psychic damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once per 10 minutes.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.
A Remove Curse, Greater Restoration, or Wish spell ends this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level and concentrate on it for the full duration, the effect lasts for 1 year. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level and concentrate on it for the full duration, the effect lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

spell.name: Tenser's Transformation

components.m: a few hairs from a bull

entries: You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess fueled by magic. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.
You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with simple and martial weapons.
When you hit a target with a weapon attack, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d12} force damage.
You have proficiency with all armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.
You have proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws.
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.
You can drop or stow anything your holding
You can draw up to two weapons
You can instantly don armor that you have on your person

entries: Immediately after the spell ends, you can drop, stow or doff anything you used this spell to draw or don. Additionally, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or your {@condition exhaustion} increases by 1.

spell.name: Blade of Disaster
entries: You create a blade-shaped planar rift about 3 feet long in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The blade lasts for the duration. When you cast this spell, you can make up to two melee spell attacks with the blade, each one against a creature, loose object, or structure within 5 feet of the blade. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d12} force damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the number on the {@dice d20} is 18 or higher. On a critical hit, the blade deals an extra {@damage 8d12} force damage (for a total of {@damage 16d12} force damage).
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the blade up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see and then make up to two melee spell attacks with it again.
The blade can harmlessly pass through any barrier, including a Wall of Force.

spell.name: Onyx Door

time.condition: which you take when a large or smaller creature you can see within 10 ft falls prone

entries: A door made of onyx manifests under the creature and opens for them to fall through. They must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (they can choose to fail), or they are teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. They cannot be teleported further than half their movement speed (ignoring any effects that are setting their movement speed to 0). You can cast this spell at the moment you fall {@condition prone} from going {@condition unconscious}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 10 ft when you reach levels 5 (20 feet), 11 (30 feet), and 17 (40 feet).

spell.name: Silent Knight
entries: Touch a willing creature to create a 5 ft radius of silence centered on them until the end of your next turn. While creatures are in the affected area they cannot create sound, cast a spell that includes a verbal component or deal thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration is extended by one round when you reach levels 5 (2 rounds), 11 (3 rounds) and 17 (4 rounds)

spell.name: Acid Mitt
entries: Acid engulfs your hand allowing it to melt through armor and damage the creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Acid damage, and has -1 AC until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Static Fuzz
entries: You release motes of static that float around a creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage, and until the end of your next turn they emit 5ft of bright light and an additional 5ft of dim light. Creatures in the bright light perceive dim light as darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Metabolize
entries: You touch a willing target and expend one of its hit dice. Roll it. They regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your spellcasting modifier. You can this once and regain all uses on a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You gain an additional use when you reach levels 5 (2 uses), 11 (3 uses), and 17 (4 uses).

spell.name: Executioner

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch gets damaged by a creature within 10 ft

entries: A willing creature of your choice within 10 ft moves up to their movement speed straight towards the damager and can spend their reaction to make a melee attack against them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, the distance the damager and the creature you choose can be within increases by 10 ft for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Uptick

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 90 ft would fail an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You tick back time a single second, allowing the target to roll another {@dice d20}. Compare the number on the die of both rolls to 18. If the new number's distance from 18 is greater than the old number's distance from 18, it replaces it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, subtract 1 from the number your comparing to for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Downtick

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 90 ft would succeed on an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You tick back time a single second, forcing the target to make a wisdom saving throw. If they fail, they roll another {@dice d20}. Compare the number on the die of both rolls to 3. If the new number's distance from 3 is greater than the old number's distance from 3, it replaces it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, add 1 to the number your comparing to for each additional slot level.

spell.name: Reclaimed Shrapnel

time.condition: which you take immediately before or after a creature you can touch would fail a saving throw

entries: You push a piece of shrapnel into each wound where they melt into golden light. Heal the target {@dice 2d2} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add {@dice 2d2} for each additional level.

spell.name: Prototype
entries: Make a crafting check to make an object. Failing the crafting check does not negatively affect the materials. If the object you craft can be attuned to, the first attempt to attune to it is instantaneous. The object has no uses of any magical limited-use features that do not regain uses at dawn, after a long rest or after a short rest. After an hour, the object turns back into the materials it was crafted out of.

spell.name: Contract
entries: You touch a contract to enchant it. One creature can sign it. If you or a creature that willingly signed the contract violates the terms of the contract then the contract ends, both creatures know the contract has ended and the violator takes {@damage 3d8} radiant, psychic or necrotic damage. Choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. The DM might allow you to replace the damage with an equivalent consequence defined in the contract. This consequence might punish the violator or aid an entity in punishing the violator. Whatever the consequence is, it has no effect whenever it would be used for anything other than punishing the violator.

If the contract is destroyed, the spell ends. The contract has AC equal to 5 + your spellcasting ability and hit points equal to 5 times the level your casting this spell at. A remove curse, greater restoration, or wish spell also ends it if it is casted at a level equal to or greater than the level this spell was casted at.

m.text: A contract made of 10gp worth of paper and ink

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, increase the damage by {@dice 2d8} for each additional slot level. Additionally, increase the duration if the spell is casted at level 3 (1 day), level 4 (1 week), level 5 (1 month), level 6 (1 year), level 7 (1 decade), level 8 (1 century), level 9 (1 millennium).

spell.name: Glide
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a glide speed of 30 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

spell.name: Burrow
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a burrow speed of 60 feet for the duration.

spell.name: Pearly Gate

time.condition: which you take when a large or smaller creature you can see within 10 ft gets up from prone

entries: A lustrous white gate manifests above the creature for them to rise through. They must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (they can choose to fail), or they pass through the gate and are teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. They cannot be teleported further than the movement they spent getting up from {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 10 ft when you reach levels 5 (15 feet), 11 (20 feet), and 17 (25 feet).

spell.name: Cloud Jump

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature you can see within 30ft moves

entries: You create a cloud for the target to momentarily step on. If the target is currently jumping, they can change the direction of their jump and can move up to 5 ft in a straight line without spending movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the distance they move by 5 ft for every additional level.

spell.name: Haunt
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 30 ft. While you are within 15 ft of the target you cannot be seen or heard except by the target and undead creatures. You show up in reflections, photography, and other things that instantly capture your likeness. If someone can see you or your likeness is captured while you are within the affected area, you appear ghostly and translucent. This spell ends if you harm a creature while you're within the affected area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, target an additional creature for each additional spell level. All of the targets can see and hear you regardless of which radius you're in.

spell.name: Wish Upon
entries: You make a wish upon the source of your magic. Roll a {@dice d2 - 1} and cast a spell of your choice. Its level must be equal to or less than your roll's total and it must be on the spell list that you prepared this spell from. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as it is prepared from a different spell list each time. You do not expend the casting time or components (except for costly components) to cast it. The casting time of this spell becomes the casting time of the spell you chose. Once you cast Wish Upon in this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a short rest.

Instead of casting a spell of your choice, you can speak aloud a wish. It can be no more than 10 words and it must start with "I wish". The DM chooses a casting time and effect based on the wish. They can utilize any vagueness, room for interpretation, or grammatical errors to make the wish do something other than what you intended. If the effect would be more powerful than the spells you could have chosen, the DM prevents this by reducing the power of the effect, adding unintended consequences, or a combination of both. Once you cast Wish Upon in this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, add a {@dice d2 - 1} to the roll for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Ghostwalk
entries: You are {@condition invisible} until you've moved 5ft, the turn ends, or you harm a creature. Undead creatures can still see you. Additionally, you show up in reflections, photography, and other similar things. If something can see you while you're {@condition invisible}, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The distance you can move increases by 5ft when you reach levels 5 (10 ft), 11 (15 ft), and 17 (20 ft).

spell.name: Snapback
entries: As a bonus action before the end of your next turn you can teleport back to the location where you casted this spell. You can use this once and regain all uses after a short rest. You fail to teleport if the location is occupied or in another plane of existence.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of times you can use this spell before resting increases by 1 when you reach Rogue levels 5 (2 uses), 11 (3 uses), and 17 (4 uses).

spell.name: Wreathe

time.condition: which you take before a willing creature you can see within 60 ft hits or misses with an attack roll.

entries: If the attack deals damage, change up to 5 of the damage to a damage type of your choice. On a hit, deal 1 extra damage of the damage type you chose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the extra damage by 1 and increase the amount of damage that is converted to a different damage type by 5 for each additional spell level.

My balancing concerns with the spell are not whether I should buff or nerf it, but whether it should exist in the first place. Pure damage output from a reaction with a trigger that will almost certainly trigger does not seem like something that should be in the game. That said, the spell feels cool to cast. Overall I'm experimenting with having reduced effects for reaction spells that have more certain triggers.

spell.name: Maze
entries: You force a creature to succeed on an intelligence saving throw or be banish into an everchanging labyrinthine demiplane.

The target can take a Study action to try to escape. When it does so, it makes a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check. If it succeeds three times in a row, it escapes, and the spell ends. For every 30 ft it moves while in the maze it can use its action in this way without expending an action.
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Silvery Barbs

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw

entries: This spell has been replaced by the Downtick and Uptick spells. If a feature would teach you this spell, learn Downtick or Uptick instead.

spell.name: Detect Poison and Disease
entries: Replaced by Detect Chemicals. If you would learn this spell, learn the spell that has replaced it instead.

spell.name: Skill Empowerment
entries: Your magic deepens a creature's understanding of its own talent. You touch one willing creature and choose a skill; until the spell ends, add 4 to ability checks it makes using that skill. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.
You must choose a skill in which the target is proficient, but does not have expertise in.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the bonus to ability checks using that skill by 1 for every 2 additional levels.

spell.name: Channel Craftsman

components.m: the insignia of a dead craftsman

entries: Choose a tool mastery. You can use two tool masteries when you make a tool check instead of one. It can be the same mastery twice. One of the tool masteries must be one of the tool masteries you chose. Undead creatures, creatures that can see through invisibility, and instant capturing of your likeness (such as reflections) perceive a spirit guiding your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the number of masteries you choose by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Beast Bond

components.m: a bit of fur wrapped in a cloth

entries: You establish a telepathic link with one beast you touch that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. Until the spell ends, the link is active while you and the beast are within line of sight of each other. Through the link, the beast can understand your telepathic messages to it, and it can telepathically communicate simple emotions and concepts back to you. While the link is active, the beast adds a {@dice d6} to its attack rolls against creatures within your reach.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, change the {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, change the {@dice d6} to a {@dice d10}.

spell.name: Booming Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes {@damage 1d8} thunder damage, and the spell ends.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you reach 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to {@damage 2d8}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 3d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Green-Flame Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause green fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Spiny Shield

time.condition: which you take when an attack deals damage to a creature you can touch

entries: An barrier of spikes interposes itself between the target and the attacker. Reduce the damage by {@dice 1d6}. If it was a melee attack, deal piercing damage to the attacker equal to the amount reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the amount reduced by {@dice 1d6} for each additional level.

spell.name: Relay

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature targets you with a ranged effect

entries: You help guide a projectile, spell, or other ranged effect to its true target. Change the target to a creature or object you can see within a number of feet equal to the effect's remaining range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add 10 to the distance you can choose a new target within for each additional level.

spell.name: Reflect

time.condition: which you take before a creature you can touch is targeted by a spell.

entries: The spell your reflecting must choose specific targets or be a line area of effect. The creature that casted the spell must make a constitution saving throw. Subtract the level of the spell you're reflecting from half the level your casting this spell at rounded up. Add the total to your Spell Save DC. On a failure, the spell is reflected. If the spell chooses specific targets, change the target to a creature you can see within the reflected spell's remaining range. If the spell is a line area of effect, change its direction starting at a point on the line you can touch.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description)

Its debatable whether a spell like this should even exist. I'll remove it if it gets out of hand. Its a lot more difficult to pull off than counterspell and only changes one of the targets so I can imagine it actually being worse that counterspell.

spell.name: Find Greater Steed
entries: Removed. If you are granted this spell, learn Find Steed instead.

spell.name: Sickening Radiance
entries: Dim, greenish light spreads within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The light spreads around corners, and it lasts until the spell ends.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 4d10} radiant damage, and increases its {@condition exhaustion} by 1. Additionally, it emits a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being {@condition invisible}. The light and any increases to {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

spell.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Animate Objects
entries: Objects animate at your command. Choose a number of nonmagical objects within range that aren't being worn or carried, aren't fixed to a surface, and aren't Gargantuan. The maximum number of objects is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; for this number, a Medium or smaller target counts as one object, a Large target counts as two, and a Huge target counts as three.

Each target animates, sprouts legs, and becomes a Construct that uses the {@creature Animated Object|GaldeveerTanksandFlanks} stat block; this creature is under your control until the spell ends or until it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Each creature you make with this spell is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count and takes its turn immediately after yours.

Until the spell ends, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and moves only to avoid harm. When the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it reverts to its object form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The creature's Slam damage increases by {@dice 1d4} - 2 (Medium or smaller), {@dice 1d6} - 1 (Large), or {@dice 1d12} (Huge) for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Beast Sense
entries: You touch a Beast that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. For the duration, you can perceive through the Beast's senses as well as your own. When perceiving through the Beast's senses, you benefit from any special senses it has. If at any point it is neither willing nor {@condition charmed} by you, the spell ends.

spell.name: Bless
entries: You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds {@dice 1d4} to the attack roll or save. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Chill Touch
entries: Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d10}), 11 ({@damage 3d10}), and 17 ({@damage 4d10}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
entries: You conjure spirits from the Elemental Planes that flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage when you hit a creature in the Emanation. This damage is Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (your choice when you make the attack).
In addition, the ground in the Emanation is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for every 2 spell slot levels above 4.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of yourself casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

entries: You attempt to interrupt the casting of a spell. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. Add the level your casting this spell at minus the level of the spell you're countering to your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If something such as a spell slot was expended to cast the spell, it is not expended.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description above).

spell.name: Crown of Madness
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The creature succeeds automatically if it isn't Humanoid.

A spectral crown appears on the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} target's head, and it must use its action before moving on each of its turns to make a melee attack against a creature that you mentally choose. You can only choose itself if there are no other targets within its reach. The target can act normally on its turn if you choose no creature. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.
On your later turns, you must take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to maintain control of the target, or the spell ends.

spell.name: Cause Fear
entries: One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains the {@condition frightened} condition against you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shroud of Knight
entries: Touch a willing creature you can see. Until the end of your next turn, dim light is darkness while within 5 ft of that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration is extended by one round when you reach levels 5 (2 rounds), 11 (3 rounds) and 17 (4 rounds)

spell.name: Daylight
entries: For the duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range and fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere. The sunlight's area is {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} and sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 60 feet.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the sunlight to fill a 60-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the sunlight.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casted at higher levels, increase the level of spell that this spell can dispel by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Dancing Lights
entries: You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing vague silhouette of yourself. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Find Steed
entries: You summon an otherworldly being that appears as a loyal steed in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The steed resembles a Large, rideable animal of your choice, such as a horse, a camel, a dire wolf, or an elk. If you already have a steed from this spell, the steed is replaced by the new one.

When you prepare this spell, choose the steed's creature type—Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as you pick a different option each time. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Steed|GaldeveerTanksAndFlanks} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose the steed's mythology—Idyllic, Biblical, or Exalted—which determines certain traits in the stat block.
The steed is your ally and obeys all of your commands. See the NPC Allies document for more information.

entries.name: Disappearance of the Steed
entries: The steed disappears if it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast this spell again, you decide whether you summon the steed that disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Find Familiar

m.text: burning incense worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You gain the service of a familiar, an otherworldly spirit which manifests as a little animal in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Familiar|GaldeveerTanksAndFlanks} stat block. If you already have a familiar from this spell, the familiar is replaced by the new one.

When you prepare the spell, choose the familiar's creature type: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as you select a different creature type each time. Whenever you cast the spell, choose the familiar's environment: Air, Land, or Water. The familiar resembles a Tiny animal of your choice—such as an owl, a cat, or a frog—that is native to the chosen environment. Both choices—creature type and environment—determine certain traits in the stat block. The familiar is your ally and obeys all of your commands.

entries.name: Remote Scouting
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can see through the familiar's eyes and hear what it hears while it is within 120 ft of you until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has.

entries.name: Disappearance of the familiar
entries: The familiar disappears if it drops to 0 hit points or if you die. When it does, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast this spell again, you decide whether you summon the familiar that disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Eyebite
entries: For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target another creature but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a save against this casting of the spell.

entries.name: Asleep
entries: The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

entries.name: Panicked
entries: The target has the Angered condition. On each of its turns, the Angered target must take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can't see you, this effect ends.

entries.name: Sickened
entries: The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for one day. Each time it fails the saving throw, increase it by a day.

spell.name: Conjure Fey
entries: You conjure a Medium spirit from the Feywild in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The spirit lasts for the duration, and it looks like a Fey creature of your choice. When the spirit appears, you can make one melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes Psychic damage equal to {@damage 3d12} plus your spellcasting ability modifier, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} or Angered condition until the start of your next turn, with both you and the spirit as the source of the fear or anger.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your later turns, you can teleport the spirit to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of the space it left and make the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d12|6-9|2d12} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Illusory Dragon
entries: By gathering threads of shadow material from the Shadowfell, you create a Huge shadowy dragon in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The illusion lasts for the spell's duration and occupies its space, as if it were a creature.

When the illusion appears, any of your enemies that can see it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature has disadvantage on attack rolls while the source of its fear is within its line of sight. If a {@condition frightened} creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the illusion, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 60 feet. At any point during its movement, you can cause it to exhale a blast of energy in a 60-foot cone originating from its space. When you create the dragon, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or poison. Each creature in the cone must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 7d6} damage of the chosen damage type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The illusion is tangible because of the shadow stuff used to create it, but attacks miss it automatically, it succeeds on all saving throws, and it is immune to all damage and conditions. A creature that uses an action to examine the dragon can determine that it is an illusion by succeeding on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through it and has advantage on saving throws against its breath.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage from the attack, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Angered condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Angered target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness
entries: You shoot a greenish ray at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. The {@condition poisoned} creature has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Contagion
entries: Your touch inflicts a magical contagion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 11d8} Necrotic damage and have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws or ability checks made with the chosen ability.

The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends on the target. If the target fails three of the saves, the spell lasts for 7 days on it.

Whenever the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target receives an effect that would end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition doesn't end on it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration doubles for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Detect Chemicals
entries: For the duration, you sense the location of poisons, acids, poisonous or venomous creatures, acidic creatures, oozes and magical contagions within 30 feet of yourself. You sense the kind of poison, acid, creature, or contagion in each case.
The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. For each ongoing spell on the target make an ability check using your spellcasting ability and add the level you're casting this spell at. The DC is 10 plus the twice opposing spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (See description)

spell.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage. Additionally, until the end of your next turn it treats moving towards you as difficult terrain while your within line of sight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Malign Missile
entries: You create a glowing dart of necrotic energy which strikes a target you can see within range, dealing {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach warlock levels 5 ({@dice 2d4}), 11 ({@dice 3d4}), and 17 ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Find Traps
entries: You sense any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes any object or mechanism that was created to cause damage or other danger. Thus, the spell would sense the {@spell Alarm|XPHB} or {@spell Glyph of Warding|XPHB} spell or a mechanical pit trap, but it wouldn't reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.
This spell reveals that a trap is present and the direction it is in but not its location. You do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.

spell.name: Enhance Ability
entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose an ability score. For the duration of this spell they add a {@dice d6} to ability checks they make that use that ability score. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2. You can choose a different ability for each target.

spell.name: Entangle
entries: Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. At the start of each of the {@condition restrained} creature's turns it can repeat the saving throw, breaking free on a success. A {@condition Restrained|XPHB} creature or a creature it is within reach of can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, it breaks free.

spell.name: Enthrall
entries: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, the target does not notice you casting this spell and has a -10 penalty to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and Passive {@skill Perception|XPHB} until the spell ends.

spell.name: Fabricate
entries: Select a gathering point of interest. Gathering checks on that point of interest and crafting checks using only materials from that point of interest during the duration of this spell take a 60th as long.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Increase the duration to an hour if you cast this at 5th or higher.

spell.name: Befuddlement

components.m: a key ring with no keys

entries: You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target makes an Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d12} Psychic damage and can't cast spells or take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action. At the end of every 30 days, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on a success. The effect can also be ended by the {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Heal|XPHB}, or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.
On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern
entries: You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 0. At the end of each of its turns the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

spell.name: Identify
entries: You touch an object throughout the spell's casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, any curses placed on it and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell's name.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

spell.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
entries: A 10-foot Emanation springs into existence around you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell fails when you cast it if the Emanation isn't big enough to fully encapsulate all creatures in its area.

Creatures and objects within the Emanation when you cast the spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells of level 3 or lower can't be cast through it, and the effects of such spells can't extend into it.

The atmosphere inside the Emanation is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside. Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to have {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} (no action required). The Emanation is opaque from the outside and of any color you choose, but it's transparent from the inside.
The spell ends early if you leave the Emanation or if you cast it again. The dome has an AC of 5 and 60 hit points. A disintegrate spell destroys it instantly.

spell.name: Mage Hand
entries: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you can see within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast this spell and as an action you can control the hand. If you do, you can move it up to 30 ft and have it perform one object interaction. The hand can hold one object that is 10 pounds or less, cannot exert more than 10 pounds of force, cannot deal damage and has no sense of touch.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Cure Head Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d4}. Once within the next minute when they take damage they can reduce the damage by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Cure Leg Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d4}. Once within the next minute they can increase their movement speed by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Cure Arm Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d4}. Once within the next minute before they hit or miss with a weapon attack they can choose to deal extra damage. On a hit, they deal extra damage of the weapon's damage type equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Mass Cure Head Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 5d4}. Once within the next minute when they take damage they can reduce the damage by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 5d8|5-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Mass Cure Arm Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 5d4}. Once within the next minute before they hit or miss with a weapon attack they can choose to deal extra damage. On a hit, they deal extra damage of the weapon's damage type equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 5d8|5-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Mass Cure Leg Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 5d4}. Once within the next minute they can increase their movement speed by an amount equal to the amount they were healed plus your spellcasting ability modifier until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 5d8|5-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Heat Metal

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame

entries: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage. The creature can drop the object to avoid taking the damage if they can.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Goodberry
entries: Ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.
Uneaten berries disappear when the spell ends.

spell.name: Friends
entries: You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn't a Humanoid, if you're fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours.

The spell ends early if the target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Hellish Rebuke

time.condition: which you take in response to a creature you can touch taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

entries: The damager is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|1-9|1d10} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Mending
entries: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Message
entries: You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Minor Illusion
entries: You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

entries.name: Sound
entries: If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

entries.name: Image
entries: If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Misty Step
entries: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher spell levels, increase the distance you teleport by 10 ft for each additional level.

spell.name: Pass without Trace
entries: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose add a +4 to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks and leave no tracks.

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
